title: Accessing Nested Arrays
content: As we have seen in earlier examples, objects can contain both nested objects and nested arrays. Similar to accessing nested objects, array bracket notation can be chained to access nested arrays.
Here is an example of how to access a nested array:
Your code should use dot and bracket notation to access myPlants

exercises.instruction: Access the myStorage object and assign the contents of the glove box property to the gloveBoxContents variable. Use dot notation for all properties where possible, otherwise use bracket notation.

hint: Your code should use dot notation, where possible, to access myStorage
gloveBoxContents should still be declared with const.
You should not change the myStorage object.
The elements in the myMusic should have at least 4 properties.
Your object in myMusic should contain the property artist which is a string.
Your object in myMusic should contain the property title which is a string.
Your object in myMusic should contain the property release_year which is a number.
Your object in myMusic should contain the  formats property which is an array.
formats should be an array of strings with at least two elements
